API endpoint for the management of a digi-save account
filter queries with keys {accountNumber, status, accountType, createdBy, customer_id}
Their combinations is also allowed, eg. 
/api/digsaver-account?accountNumber=""&accountType=""

This get specific  withdrawal policies based on the specified filer, keys = {"name", "totalAllowedWithdrawals", "maxAmountAllowed"}

item.name: List all accounts on withdrawal policy

request.description: Adds new scheme to the system.
Adds new scheme to the system.
Removes a withdrawal policy only if there is no account bound to it. Make sure no accounts used this policy before removing it

item.description:
Policies to control how frequency, interval,  a customer can withdraw from his/her account, 
Fiters that can be apply to this api point {"name", "totalAllowedWithdrawals", "maxAmountAllowed"}
eg. /digisaver-acccount/withdrawal-scheme?name=""
To delete a policy, make sure that policy is not used by any account. This indicate that first all the account using the policy must be update to use the new policy before the old policy can be delete. There is no api endpoint that specify how to remove policy from account because withdrawal policy is required by all accounts

item.name: System
List all Employees in the system

request.description: Search for employee with filter by keys {'workId', 'type', 'employedDate',}
The user must be already registered in the system. Employee is created with a default type "OTHER".  Other types like MANAGER, ACCOUNTANT AND SALES-PERSON can be specified
Removes employee details from the system, hence reducing priviliges
List all branches without filter
Search for a branch with filter by keys {"name", 'location', 'dateCreated', 'createdBy'}
List all branches without filter

This delete a branch and its all related data from the system. Please execute this query with care. It removes all accounts, savings plans, and employees from the system. This is due to the cascade deletion of DTO's. Warning: don't ever use this query
